body:
Thanks for reporting this @AlbertWh1te. Could you share if you are using conda or vanilla pip? 

I don't think we have access to M1 and without that we're not going to able to reproduce the issue.

The error seems to be coming from numba/numpy so could you try to install just those two packages in a separate venv to help isolate the problem?

@AlbertWh1te I have received a similar error (indeed from numba) using the [following link](https://numba.discourse.group/t/wheels-for-apple-silicon-m1/1282/2) I am able to install numba, after which I was able to succesfully install sktime using `pip install sktime` (all this on an m1 pro).
Great! I'll close the issue then.

So, reason for closing is, the culprit was the `numba` installation, not `sktime`?

We may want to add the advice to "frequent errors" on the installation page?
Combination of M1 and numba. I expect that this will be a common pattern for M1 and any dependency that has a C extension requiring compiling and does now have dedicated wheels yet.

While it was possible to install sktime, the module sktime-all-extras is not available for M1 and I'm seeing strange behaviors when following the notebooks of [sktime tutorial shown in PyData Berlin 2022](https://github.com/sktime/sktime-tutorial-pydata-berlin-2022) For example, not all forecasters are available, and I can't use the predict_var method for some reason.
Hm, your strange behaviour sounds like using an older version of sktime, @renejra - what´s your local sktime version?
@fkiraly I have 0.10.0 installed, build pyh27d4807_0 from conda-forge
newest is 0.11.3, that would explain your problems...

@fkiraly unfortunately newer version (0.11.3) faces dependency issues on M1 Macs. I'll keep debugging and give a heads up if I'm able to install sktime with all extras, and how I did it (if successful)
